name: Crocodile
interestingFacts: Crocodiles are excellent swimmers and can move quickly in water.
Crocodiles have a powerful bite force and a strong digestive system that can break down bones.
Crocodiles have a four-chambered heart, similar to birds and mammals.
Crocodiles are known for their ancient lineage and have been around for millions of years.
Female crocodiles build nests and lay eggs, which they guard until they hatch.
Crocodiles are cold-blooded reptiles that rely on external sources of heat to regulate their body temperature.
Crocodiles have a unique gland in their mouths that helps them excrete excess salt, allowing them to live in both freshwater and saltwater habitats.
